page.title: 11AGRICULTURAL ENGINEERING
page.content: In Yeaveley there is an agricultural engineer. He makes steel structures for use in farming - trailors, the steel framework for haybarns, the framework for horse boxes and steel gates. He also mends farm machinery. He uses sheet steel and steel rods. He uses tig, stick, mig and oxy-acetylene welding. He uses 3 bottles of gas a month.He does some work in the workshop and sometimes he goes out to jobs. Some of his work goes to Denmark. His workshop is in one of the old sheds at Yeaveley House Farm. He will be moving to a new workshop across the road in July. He has been in the job for 21 years. He has been on his own for 9 years. Now he has another man to help him. He is very important to local farmers.
